meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of anarchy.
meanings.sent1: The chaotic protest was truly anarchical.
meanings.sent2: The group of rebellious teenagers had an anarchical attitude towards rules.
meanings.sent3: The classroom turned anarchical when the teacher stepped out for a minute.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an anarchical maze of conflicting thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The storm left behind an anarchical mess of fallen trees and debris.

meanings.sent1: The abandoned house had an anarchical appearance with broken windows and overgrown weeds.
meanings.sent2: The party descended into an anarchical frenzy as the night went on.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen was in an anarchical state after the cooking experiment gone wrong.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were like an anarchical whirlwind, impossible to organize.
meanings.sent5: The traffic jam caused an anarchical situation on the busy street.
